intro: Melampyrum pratense var. hians, commonly known as the slender touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and pairs of opposite, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. This variety is often found in the northern hemisphere and is known for its parasitic nature, deriving nutrients from its host plants.
